briefdescription.para: Restrict the dates that can be selected in the control to the specified range.

detaileddescription.para: If either date is set, the corresponding limit will be enforced and true returned. If none are set, the existing restrictions are removed and false is returned.

parameterdescription.para: The low limit for the dates shown by the control or wxDefaultDateTime.
The high limit for the dates shown by the control or wxDefaultDateTime.

simplesect.para: true if either limit is valid, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Returns the limits currently being used.

parameterdescription.para: If non-NULL, the value of the low limit for the dates shown by the control is returned (which may be wxDefaultDateTime if no limit is set).
If non-NULL, the value of the upper limit for the dates shown by the control is returned (which may be wxDefaultDateTime if no limit is set).

simplesect.para: true if either limit is set, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Default constructor.

briefdescription.para: Does the same as Create() method.
Destroys the control.

briefdescription.para: Creates the control.

detaileddescription.para: See wxWindow::wxWindow() for the meaning of the parameters and the control overview for the possible styles.

briefdescription.para: This function should be used instead of changing wxCAL_SHOW_HOLIDAYS style bit directly.

detaileddescription.para: It enables or disables the special highlighting of the holidays.

briefdescription.para: This function should be used instead of changing wxCAL_NO_MONTH_CHANGE style bit.

detaileddescription.para: It allows or disallows the user to change the month interactively. Note that if the month cannot be changed, the year cannot be changed neither.

simplesect.para: true if the value of this option really changed or false if it was already set to the requested value.

detaileddescription.para: This function should be used instead of changing wxCAL_NO_YEAR_CHANGE style bit directly. It allows or disallows the user to change the year interactively. Only in generic wxCalendarCtrl.

briefdescription.para: Returns the attribute for the given date (should be in the range 1...31).

detaileddescription.para: The returned pointer may be NULL. Only in generic wxCalendarCtrl.

briefdescription.para: Gets the currently selected date.
Gets the background colour of the header part of the calendar window.

detaileddescription.para: This method is currently only implemented in generic wxCalendarCtrl and always returns wxNullColour in the native versions.

briefdescription.para: Gets the foreground colour of the header part of the calendar window.

detaileddescription.para: This method is currently only implemented in generic wxCalendarCtrl and always returns wxNullColour in the native versions.

briefdescription.para: Gets the background highlight colour.

detaileddescription.para: Only in generic wxCalendarCtrl.
This method is currently only implemented in generic wxCalendarCtrl and always returns wxNullColour in the native versions.

briefdescription.para: Gets the foreground highlight colour.

detaileddescription.para: Only in generic wxCalendarCtrl.
This method is currently only implemented in generic wxCalendarCtrl and always returns wxNullColour in the native versions.

briefdescription.para: Return the background colour currently used for holiday highlighting.

detaileddescription.para: Only useful with generic wxCalendarCtrl as native versions currently don't support holidays display at all and always return wxNullColour.

briefdescription.para: Return the foreground colour currently used for holiday highlighting.

detaileddescription.para: Only useful with generic wxCalendarCtrl as native versions currently don't support holidays display at all and always return wxNullColour.

briefdescription.para: Returns one of wxCalendarHitTestResult constants and fills either date or wd pointer with the corresponding value depending on the hit test code.

detaileddescription.para: Not implemented in wxGTK currently.

briefdescription.para: Clears any attributes associated with the given day (in the range 1...31).

detaileddescription.para: Only in generic wxCalendarCtrl.

briefdescription.para: Associates the attribute with the specified date (in the range 1...31).

detaileddescription.para: If the pointer is NULL, the items attribute is cleared. Only in generic wxCalendarCtrl.

briefdescription.para: Sets the current date.

detaileddescription.para: The date parameter must be valid and in the currently valid range as set by SetDateRange(), otherwise the current date is not changed and the function returns false.

briefdescription.para: Set the colours used for painting the weekdays at the top of the control.

detaileddescription.para: This method is currently only implemented in generic wxCalendarCtrl and does nothing in the native versions.

briefdescription.para: Set the colours to be used for highlighting the currently selected date.

detaileddescription.para: This method is currently only implemented in generic wxCalendarCtrl and does nothing in the native versions.

briefdescription.para: Marks the specified day as being a holiday in the current month.

detaileddescription.para: This method is only implemented in the generic version of the control and does nothing in the native ones.

briefdescription.para: Sets the colours to be used for the holidays highlighting.

detaileddescription.para: This method is only implemented in the generic version of the control and does nothing in the native ones. It should also only be called if the window style includes wxCAL_SHOW_HOLIDAYS flag or EnableHolidayDisplay() had been called.

briefdescription.para: Mark or unmark the day.

detaileddescription.para: This day of month will be marked in every month. In generic wxCalendarCtrl,

briefdescription.para: The calendar control allows the user to pick a date.

detaileddescription.para: The user can move the current selection using the keyboard and select the date (generating EVT_CALENDAR event) by pressing <Return> or double clicking it.

Generic calendar has advanced possibilities for the customization of its display, described below. If you want to use these possibilities on every platform, use wxGenericCalendarCtrl instead of wxCalendarCtrl.
All global settings (such as colours and fonts used) can, of course, be changed. But also, the display style for each day in the month can be set independently using wxCalendarDateAttr class.

An item without custom attributes is drawn with the default colours and font and without border, but setting custom attributes with SetAttr() allows to modify its appearance. Just create a custom attribute object and set it for the day you want to be displayed specially (note that the control will take ownership of the pointer, i.e. it will delete it itself). A day may be marked as being a holiday, even if it is not recognized as one by wxDateTime using the wxCalendarDateAttr::SetHoliday() method.
As the attributes are specified for each day, they may change when the month is changed, so you will often want to update them in EVT_CALENDAR_PAGE_CHANGED event handler.
This class supports the following styles:

listitem.para: wxCAL_SUNDAY_FIRST: Show Sunday as the first day in the week (not in wxGTK)
wxCAL_MONDAY_FIRST: Show Monday as the first day in the week (not in wxGTK)
wxCAL_SHOW_HOLIDAYS: Highlight holidays in the calendar (only generic)
wxCAL_NO_YEAR_CHANGE: Disable the year changing (deprecated, only generic)
wxCAL_NO_MONTH_CHANGE: Disable the month (and, implicitly, the year) changing
wxCAL_SHOW_SURROUNDING_WEEKS: Show the neighbouring weeks in the previous and next months (only generic, always on for the native controls)
wxCAL_SEQUENTIAL_MONTH_SELECTION: Use alternative, more compact, style for the month and year selection controls. (only generic)

wxCAL_SHOW_WEEK_NUMBERS: Show week numbers on the left side of the calendar. (not in generic)
Events emitted by this class

detaileddescription.para: The following event handler macros redirect the events to member function handlers 'func' with prototypes like: voidhandlerFuncName(wxCalendarEvent&event)

Event macros for events emitted by this class:
EVT_CALENDAR(id, func): A day was double clicked in the calendar.
EVT_CALENDAR_SEL_CHANGED(id, func): The selected date changed.
EVT_CALENDAR_PAGE_CHANGED(id, func): The selected month (and/or year) changed.
EVT_CALENDAR_WEEKDAY_CLICKED(id, func): User clicked on the week day header (only generic).
EVT_CALENDAR_WEEK_CLICKED(id, func): User clicked on the week of the year number (only generic).
Changing the selected date will trigger an EVT_CALENDAR_DAY, MONTH or YEAR event as well as an EVT_CALENDAR_SEL_CHANGED event.
